title: IAF, govt announce compensation
text:
AHMEDABAD: Senior Air Staff Officer Air Marshal AD Joshi from SWAC, while condoling the victims of the air crash, announced an immediate ex-gratia payment of Rs one lakh and Rs 50,000 for every adult and child below 12 years killed respectively.

This was in accordance with the norms of defencerelated disasters, where Rs 5.5 lakh and Rs 2.75 lakh were compensation amounts stipulated per adult and child below 12 years. The compensation offered immediately would be deducted from this sum, said SWAC sources.

The state govermment has also sanctioned Rs 50,000 to the next of kin of the youth who was killled, and Rs 25,000 for the families of the three children who also died in the crash.

title: I don't like politics: Priyanka
text:
JAMMU: On the threshold of a political career, Priyanka has confessed she dislikes politics.

JAMMU: Priyanka Vadra went to see Kashmiri children, victims of militancy, here on Friday. And she reportedly told them she disliked politics, but would probably join it.
Priyanka Vadra: Will she, wonâ€™t she join politics?
Sources told Times News Network that the Congress president''s daughter organised a workshop under the banner of the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation at Jammu University for the victims of militancy.

Priyanka, her husband, Robert, and brother Rahul arrived here on Thursday. The trio undertook a pilgrimage to the Vaishno Devi shrine.

Leaving her husband and brother at the hotel, Hari Niwas, on Friday morning, Priyanka went to interact with at least 50 Kashmiri children, most of whom were orphans.

The sources said that Priyanka identified herself as a victim of militancy, too, to the children.

"My father was also killed by terrorists and I can feel your pain. I know what it means to lose one''s father," she said.

In reply to a query, she said that she did not like politics. "But sometimes, one has to do things even if one dislikes them," was her reported reply.

title: 'State will go by rule book on Sonia's security'
text:
HYDERABAD: The Congress need not have any doubts about the state government''s ability to provide security to the AICC president Sonia Gandhi, chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu said on Friday.

Allaying fears expressed by some Congress leaders on Thursday, Naidu told reporters at NTR Trust Bhavan that the TDP may have ideological and political differences with the Congress party. It also opposes Sonia Gandhi becoming the Prime Minister of the country. But this does not make us blind towards discharge of our duty.

Naidu said the state government will provide full security to the AICC president whenever she visits the state. The state government goes by rule book on such issues, he said.

Naidu also favoured funding of elections by the state. He said a detailed debate on this was necessary and political parties should come to a consensus so that a legislation could be brought in. This would reduce poll expenditure and would be a major electoral reform.

Earlier, addressing 5000 party volunteers at NAC grounds who are undergoing special training in crowd management for Vijayabheri, Naidu criticised Congress party and its policies.

He said a country which stood as one and opposed British rule, can never accept Sonia Gandhi. Vote for Sonia would be a matter of shame for the country, he added. He said it was unfortunate that the TRS had mortgaged the pride of Telangana to Sonia Gandhi and the party led by her.

title: Traffic curbs in city from 10 am to 11 pm
text:
HYDERABAD: The city police announced traffic diversions in connection with the TDP''s Vijayabheri being organised at the Parade Grounds on Sunday. The restrictions would be in force on Sunday from 10 am to 11 pm.

Traffic from Begumpet, Upkaar and Tarnaka would be diverted at Rasoolpura Crossroads, YMCA and Alugaddabawi towards Ministers Road, Garden Restaurant and Chilkalguda crossroads respectively. Traffic from Skyline theatre, Himayatnagar and Sadhuram Eye Hospital would not be allowed towards Basheerbagh and Liberty junction.

General traffic will not be allowed towards BJR statue from AR Petrol Pump and will be diverted towards Chapel Road. Vehicles from SBH Gunfoundry would be diverted towards Chapel Road and would not be allowed towards BJR statue.

At Old Telugu Talli statue, traffic from Ravindra Bharati, Dwaraka Hotel and Iqbal Minar would not be allowed to Upper Tank Bund and would be diverted towards the NTR Marg.

At Sailing Club Junction, traffic from Kavadiguda side would not be allowed to enter Upper Tank Bund. Vehicles from Ranigunj and Bansilalpet side would not be allowed towards Karbala Maidan and Bible House respectively.

Traffic will not be allowed to enter Gas Mandi junction, Bata junction and Patny junction from either side of the junctions.

It has also issued restrictions for private contract carriages from 7 am to 11 pm on Sunday.

Buses from BHEL, Kukatpally, SR Nagar, Ameerpet, Lakdikapul, Bahadurpura, Afzalgunj, Dilsukhnagar, Malakpet and Secunderabad will not be allowed to move or halt on city roads.

Further, local and non-local lorries would not be allowed movement from 8 pm on February 21 to 8 am on February 23. All lorries entering the ring road and Attapur bridge would not be allowed towards Retibowli and Mehdipatnam and diverted at Moghal ka Nala either towards Rajendranagar or Lunger Houz. At Lunger Houz crossroads, lorries would not be allowed towards Nanalnagar, Mehdipatnam, Tombs Road and Tolichowki.

title: Fernandes assails Rabri govt
text:
SITAMARHI: Describing Bihar as a fit case for imposition of President''s rule, NDA convenor George Fernandes said on Friday if voted to power, the ruling alliance would definitely consider bringing the state under central rule.

"Bihar is a fit case for imposition of President''s rule. NDA thrice tried to bring the state under President''s rule, but failed due to lack of majority in the Rajya Sabha. If NDA is voted back to power, it will definitely consider bringing the state under central rule to end the corrupt and inefficient RJD regime," Fernandes told a public meeting at Chorauth block of the district. He said the Laloo-Rabri rule proved to be the "darkest" era in the state. PTI

"Law and order has worsened. No development is taking place ... People are fed up with the inefficient and corrupt administration under Rabri Devi," he said and appealed to the people to "teach them a lesson" in the coming Lok Sabha polls.

Fernandes said the NDA government by approving a large number of development schemes in the field of railway, power, road and other sectors had tried to pull the state out of backwardness, but due to lack of matching efforts from the state government, the objective could not be achieved.

Local JD(U) MP in the dissolved Lok Sabha Nawal Kishore Rai also assailed the RJD ministry. PTI

title: JD(U) sees red as BJP to go it alone in polls
text:
DHANBAD: The decision of BJP, the leading partner in the NDAâ€™s state government, to go it alone in the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections, has made its ally, the JD(U) see red.

The refusal by the BJP to accept JD(U) as a partner and a national party, has not only embarrassed the state JD(U) leaderhip, but the BJPâ€™s plea that the JD(U) has no base in the state has further aggrieved it.

A delegation led by the state JD(U) president Gautam Sagar Rana, comprising Lalchand Mahto and Tarkeshwar Singh, rushed to the central party leadership and apprised them of the mood of party rank and files in the state.

The party leadership kept its voice mum on the issue and defered its decision till month end. George Fernandes and Sharad Yadav informed the delegation that the issue would be decided in Ranchi on March 1. The JD(U) also hurriedly called a rally on the fateful day to counter the BJPâ€™s plea. Preparations are on to make the show a success.

title: Madhuri's fan irked at Haryana govt's move
text:
RANCHI: Noted film actress Madhuri Dixitâ€™s admirer Pappu Sardar has done it again.

The â€˜dhak-dhakâ€™ girlâ€™s fan who has been celebrating her birthday religiously for years now- sometimes with the physically challenged at Jamshedpur-based Cheshire Home or at the Old Age Home- now wants to give Rs 1.75 lakh to the Haryana government as payment for a plot of land at Panchkula, which was given away by chief minister Bhajan Lal to the actress at government rate.

Not ready to listen to any logic Pappu is angry with the Haryana government for sending a notice to the actress for paying the amount. â€œIt is not that she will not be able to pay, but I appeal to the Haryana government to accept my offer through the media,â€� he argued. Later, he said the plot of land could be used as an old age home or a home for the disabled, he added.

According to Pappu, newspaper reports suggest that Bhajan Lal had offered a plot of land to Diksit at a government rate of Rs 2.35 lakh, of which she had already paid an initial amount of Rs 60,000. On February 15, this year, the Haryana government reportedly served a notice to Madhuri asking her to pay up the remaining Rs 1.75, failing which, the land would be allotted to somebody else. Donning a â€˜Devdas kurtaâ€™ with images of Shahrukh and Madhuri, Pappu says that this will make him very happy for if he can do something for somebody who is his inspiration and who made him what he is today. No regrets if Madhuri has not once acknowledged his existence or the good work he is doing in her name.

â€œWe pray to God and make many offerings in His name, but is it necessary that god reciprocates?â€� he asked. Pappu who used to celebrate Madhuriâ€™s birthday by offering free plates of â€˜chaatâ€™ to the residents of the Steel City, now spends his time on the occasion at the Cheshire Home and has even donated a park for children of the home. The Madhuri fan also celebrates â€˜rakhiâ€™ at the home and with senior citizens at the old age home.

But Pappu would not like his inspiration to join politics. â€œActors should expose politicians and not run after politics,â€� he said.

title: UP govt hikes salaries of ministers, MLAs
text:
LUCKNOW: Notwithstanding the financial crunch, the Uttar Pradesh government today announced hike in salaries of ministers and legislators ahead of Lok Sabha polls.

Winding up the debate on budget proposals in the state assembly, Chief Minister Mulayam Singh Yadav announced the hike in salaries of legislators from existing Rs 2,000 to Rs 3,000 per month.

Similarly, the salaries of cabinet rank ministers have been increased from Rs 2,500 to Rs 5,000 while the Ministers of State would get an increased salary of Rs 4,000 as against Rs 2,250.

Besides, the salaries the perks of the legislators and ministers have also been increased, Yadav announced.

title: UP government withdraws controversial order
text:
LUCKNOW: Under attack from the BJP and Sangh Parivar, the Mulayam Singh government in Uttar Pradesh on Friday withdrew its controversial order to close teaching work in government schools and intermediate colleges by 12.00 noon on Fridays to facilitate Muslims to offer prayers.

The announcement of rescinding the order was made by the Chief Minister in the state assembly while replying to the debate on budget proposals.

However, the government authorised District Magistrates to take a decision in this regard at the local level in consultation with the district school authorities especially in pre-dominantly Muslim areas.

title: Sahara journo assaulted at Mayawati rally
text:
MUMBAI: A reporter from Sahara Samay Mumbai, a local TV channel, was assaulted by Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) workers at a rally addressed by BSP leader Mayawati at Shivaji Park on Friday.

The reporter, Shailesh Mohite, suffered injuries on the head and back. A spokesperson from Sahara said a complaint has been lodged at Shivaji Park police station.

The channel was covering the rally live. According to Mr Mohite, the BSP workers took offence when he reported that 30,000 people attended the rally.

"They wanted me to say before the camera that lakhs of workers had assembled for the rally." When he refused to oblige, the BSP activists assaulted him.

title: Fake cop blackmails govt official
text:
BANGALORE: Policemen in â€˜plainclothesâ€™ seem to come up with ingenious ways to con unsuspecting victims. While gullible women have been cheated of their jewellery, others have been robbed of their cash and valuables.

A recent case where a government official was threatened he would be implicated in an immoral trafficking case by a â€˜policemanâ€™ has come to light.

The official in the information department has lodged a complaint with the Commercial Street police stating that a person posing as a policeman threatened to implicate him in an immoral trafficking case and extorted money from him.

In his complaint, the victim has stated that when he was walking near Chinnaswamy Stadium, the miscreant accosted him and got his address and telephone numbers. He then told him he was a policeman and threatened to implicate him in the case. The victim handed him Rs 1,500 as against a demand for Rs 5,000. The following day, the miscreant landed at the victimâ€™s office and managed to extort more money. The police are now on the lookout for the miscreant.

Five injured in boiler explosion: Five workers were injured when a boiler exploded at a laundry unit in Manorayanapalya in Hebbal police station limits on Thursday night. The incident took place around 10 pm at Uniwash Pvt Ltd when work was on at the unit and a boiler used to clean clothes exploded. Vannachari (42), Puttaraju (21), Pushpa (30), Uma (28) and Siddaraju (25), who were on the night shift, were injured. The police were yet to ascertain the reason for the explosion.

Brothel raided: Hebbal police raided a brothel being run in a house in Tata Nagar and arrested three persons, including a woman. The police also seized VCDs containing pornographic material, a television set, a VCD player and mobiles. The arrested, Satish and Prasanna, along with their accomplice who is absconding, contacted clients over phone and provided them with transportation, the police added. MLC robbed in bus

Thieves stole a bag of gold jewellery and other valuables worth over Rs 18,500 belonging to an MLC who was travelling to Bangalore in a KSRTC bus. In her complaint with the Vidhana Soudha police, Rathna V. Kushnoor stated she had boarded the bus to Bangalore from Bidar on Wednesday. The following morning, she got off at Sankey Road and took an autorickshaw to the Legislatorsâ€™ Home where she found that the valuables had been stolen.

title: No tariff increase by Tata Power
text:
MUMBAI: Tata Power Company on Friday proposed a change in tariff structure without increasing the tariff, to encourage economic use of resources by consumers and progressively move towards structure which reflected the cost of supply.

In its tariff rationalisation proposal submitted before the Maharashtra Electricity Regulatory Commission (MERC), TPC also proposed a franchisee system under which a franchisee would provide power to the individual industrial and residential units from a single bulk supply point at a commission of 10 to 15 paise/Kwh on TPC''s prevailing HT and LT tariff.

The company said that pursuant to the rationalisation, the overall revenue realisation for TPC would reduce marginally by about Rs ten crore.

"The rationalisation is essentially aimed at reducing anomalies in tariff structure and is not expected to substantially alter the aggregate revenue realisation from individual categories/licencees," it said.

It also proposed two bands of tariff while adopting Time-of-the-Day tariff for bulk licencees, Railways, and HT category of customers to increase consumption during the night hours when there is low-peak time.

"If power consumption increases during night it would reduce the demand on utility to set up capacity to meet peak demand," TPC said.

title: 4 held for threatening college principal
text:
PUNE: The Chatushrungi police on Thursday arrested four persons and booked some others for allegedly threatening Spicer college principal Justin Devdas and creating chaos on the college campus.

The arrested, Nixon Balyya, Jayesh Patil, Dinesh Girate and Arvind Bhagate, were later released on bail.

The police said one of the accused, Christina Gill, debarred from the college after she had a fight with the warden in September 2003. After which, the police said, she allegedly asked some people to threaten the principal.

Gill and others have been booked for rioting, but have not been arrested.

The police said nearly 15 men entered the college on Monday and allegedly threatened the principal. On their way out, they broke window panes of the college, they added.

title: Sena-BJP for concurrent polls, threaten resignation
text:
MUMBAI: Shiv Sena-BJP combine on Saturday threatened to resign from Maharashtra Legislative Assembly if Congress-NCP led DF government did not go for simultaneous polls in the state.

"The Shiv Sena-BJP combine has decided that they would ask their members to resign from the State Assembly if Congress-NCP led DF government in the state did not go for assembly polls simultaneously with Lok Sabha elections," said BJP General Secretary Pramod Mahajan.

Mahajan alleged that the DF government was putting burden on the people of the state by opting for separate polls.

Sena-BJP would not be a part of it but resign if the DF government did not go for simultaneous elections, he reiterated.

The Shiv Sena would contest 22 seats, while BJP would field candidates in 26 others in the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections, the party''s General Secretary said.

The constituencies which are allocated in 1999 Lok Sabha elections for the parties would remain as it is, he added.
